'Campinas' (, Plains) is a Brazilian city of SÃ£o Paulo State, in the country's
Southeast Region. According to the 2010 Census, the city population is
1,080,999, making it the fourteenth most populous Brazilian city and
the third in the SÃ£o Paulo state. The city's metropolitan area, the Greater
Campinas, as of 2013, contains nineteen cities, including Campinas, and has a
total population of 2,832,297 people. http://www.ibge.gov.br/home/estatisti-
ca/populacao/estimativa2011/estimativa.shtm

The city is home to the University of Campinas, one of the most prestigious in
Latin America.
